item.title: The European Union and the Crisis in the Spanish Constitution
item.description: Cecilia Rizcallah, Research Fellow at the Belgian National Fund for Scientific Research affiliated both to Université Saint-Louis Bruxelles and Université libre de Bruxelles Background For over a month, Spain has been grappling with a constitutional crisis stemming from pro-independence sentiments in Catalonia. These sentiments culminated in an independence referendum held on October 1, 2017, orchestrated by the Catalan government under President Carles Puigdemont. Barcelona claims that 90% of the 43% voter turnout favored independence.
